file_content.text: Am I seeing things? I didn't think there was anyone else left alive on this planet.
What's the word from Aurek Base? There's nothing on the comm but static. I was starting to think they pulled out and left us.
Aurek Base is in bad shape. They took heavy casualties, and they need all the help they can get.
You should head back.
See? I told you to stop being so negative. They didn't leave us. They're just nearly all dead.
Right. You're a model of optimism.
Is everyone alright?
No, just cold and sick of emergency rations.
Not that getting back to Aurek Base will change that.
There are still Imperial troops in the area. Can you get back to the base on your own?
Will you be okay out there?
We can handle it now that we've got supplies.
What about our mission? We can't leave the sensors like this.
I thought you'd be anxious to get back to the base. Did I miss something?
What's the problem?
Just get back to the base alive. The sensors can wait.
We don't have time for this.
We came out here to check the long-range sensors. They were damaged in the attack, but they're easily fixable.
If you can get to them, which we obviously couldn't.
I'll deal with the sensors.
Without the sensors, Aurek Base is blind. They won't have any warning the Empire is coming.
If you can reach the arrays, you can bring them back online. There are a lot of Imperials in the area, though.
We'd better get moving if we're not going to freeze to death. See you back at the base.
